slides.title: Welcome to CIMA BA1
slides.content:
# BA1 - Fundamentals of Business Economics

BA1 covers **economic principles** for business.

## What You Will Learn

- **Microeconomics** - Markets and firms
- **Macroeconomics** - National economy
- **Business Environment** - External factors
- **Government** - Policy impact

## Syllabus Areas

| Area | Weight |
|------|--------|
| Microeconomics | 30% |
| Macroeconomics | 30% |
| Business environment | 20% |
| Government | 20% |

slides.title: Demand and Supply
slides.content:
# Market Fundamentals

## Demand Curve

```
Price up -> Quantity demanded down
Price down -> Quantity demanded up
```

## Supply Curve

```
Price up -> Quantity supplied up
Price down -> Quantity supplied down
```

## Market Equilibrium

| Condition | Result |
|-----------|--------|
| Demand > Supply | Price rises |
| Supply > Demand | Price falls |
| Demand = Supply | Equilibrium |

slides.title: Elasticity
slides.content:
# Price Elasticity

## Formula

```
PED = % Change in Quantity / % Change in Price
```

## Interpretation

| Value | Type |
|-------|------|
| >1 | Elastic |
| =1 | Unitary |
| <1 | Inelastic |

## Factors Affecting PED

- Availability of substitutes
- Necessity vs luxury
- Proportion of income
- Time period

## Income Elasticity

- Normal goods: Positive
- Inferior goods: Negative

slides.title: Elasticity Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: If PED is greater than 1, demand is?

slides.title: Market Structures
slides.content:
# Types of Markets

## Characteristics

| Structure | Sellers | Price |
|-----------|---------|-------|
| Perfect competition | Many | Market price |
| Monopoly | One | Price maker |
| Oligopoly | Few | Price leader |
| Monopolistic | Many | Differentiated |

## Perfect Competition

- Homogeneous products
- Free entry and exit
- Perfect information

## Monopoly

- Single seller
- Barriers to entry
- Price setting power

slides.title: Costs and Revenue
slides.content:
# Firm Economics

## Cost Concepts

| Cost | Definition |
|------|------------|
| Fixed | Does not vary with output |
| Variable | Varies with output |
| Total | FC + VC |
| Marginal | Additional unit cost |

## Average Costs

```
AC = TC / Q
AFC = FC / Q
AVC = VC / Q
```

## Revenue

| Type | Formula |
|------|--------|
| Total | P x Q |
| Average | TR / Q |
| Marginal | Additional unit revenue |

slides.title: National Income
slides.content:
# Macroeconomic Measures

## GDP

```
Gross Domestic Product
= Value of all goods/services produced
```

## Calculation Methods

| Method | Approach |
|--------|----------|
| Expenditure | C + I + G + (X-M) |
| Income | Wages + Profits + Rent |
| Output | Sum of value added |

## Real vs Nominal

```
Real GDP = Nominal GDP / Price Index x 100

Removes inflation effect
```

slides.title: GDP Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Expenditure method: GDP = C + I + G + ?

slides.title: Business Cycle
slides.content:
# Economic Cycles

## Phases

```
Expansion -> Peak -> Contraction -> Trough
```

## Characteristics

| Phase | Features |
|-------|----------|
| Expansion | Growing output |
| Peak | Maximum activity |
| Contraction | Declining output |
| Trough | Minimum activity |

## Indicators

| Type | Timing |
|------|--------|
| Leading | Predict changes |
| Coincident | Same time |
| Lagging | Follow changes |

slides.title: Inflation
slides.content:
# Price Level Changes

## Measurement

```
CPI = (Current basket / Base basket) x 100
```

## Types

| Type | Cause |
|------|-------|
| Demand-pull | Excess demand |
| Cost-push | Rising costs |
| Built-in | Expectations |

## Effects

| On | Impact |
|----|--------|
| Savers | Lose purchasing power |
| Borrowers | Benefit |
| Fixed income | Hurt |
| Exports | Less competitive |

slides.title: Monetary Policy
slides.content:
# Central Bank Policy

## Tools

| Tool | Action |
|------|--------|
| Interest rates | Raise or lower |
| Open market | Buy/sell bonds |
| Reserve requirements | Bank reserves |

## Objectives

- Price stability
- Economic growth
- Employment
- Exchange rate

## Transmission

```
Interest rate change
-> Affects borrowing
-> Changes spending
-> Impacts output/prices
```

slides.title: Fiscal Policy
slides.content:
# Government Policy

## Tools

| Tool | Action |
|------|--------|
| Taxation | Revenue collection |
| Spending | Government expenditure |
| Borrowing | Budget deficit |

## Budget Positions

| Position | Meaning |
|----------|--------|
| Surplus | Revenue > Spending |
| Deficit | Spending > Revenue |
| Balanced | Equal |

## Multiplier Effect

```
Initial spending
-> Creates income
-> More spending
-> Larger overall effect
```

slides.title: International Trade
slides.content:
# Global Economics

## Comparative Advantage

```
Specialize in what you produce
at lower opportunity cost
```

## Trade Barriers

| Barrier | Type |
|---------|------|
| Tariffs | Taxes |
| Quotas | Quantity limits |
| Subsidies | Support domestic |

## Exchange Rates

| System | Determination |
|--------|---------------|
| Fixed | Government set |
| Floating | Market forces |
| Managed | Intervention |

slides.title: Business Environment
slides.content:
# External Factors

## PESTEL Analysis

| Factor | Examples |
|--------|----------|
| Political | Government |
| Economic | Growth, inflation |
| Social | Demographics |
| Technological | Innovation |
| Environmental | Sustainability |
| Legal | Regulations |

## Porter's Five Forces

- Competitive rivalry
- Supplier power
- Buyer power
- Threat of substitutes
- Threat of new entrants
